GenOO::Data::File GFF
SummaryIncluded librariesPackage variablesSynopsisDescriptionGeneral documentationMethods
Summary
GenOO::Data::File::GFF - Object implementing methods for accessing gff formatted files (http://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/gff/spec.html)
Package variables
No package variables defined.
Included modules
FileHandle
GenOO::Data::File::GFF::Record
Inherit
GenOO::_Initializable
Synopsis
    # Object that manages a gff file. 

    # To initialize 
    my $gff_file = GenOO::Data::File::GFF->new({
        FILE            => undef,
        EXTRA_INFO      => undef,
    });
Description
    This object offers methods to read a gff file line by line.

Methods code
_initdescriptionprevnextTop
sub _init {
	my ($self,$data) = @_;
	
	$self->set_file($$data{FILE});
	$self->set_extra($$data{EXTRA_INFO});
	
	$self->open($self->get_file);
	
	$self->init_header;
	$self->init_records_cache;
	$self->init_records_read_count;
	
	$self->parse_header_section;
}
add_to_records_cachedescriptionprevnextTop
sub add_to_records_cache {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	push @{$self->{RECORDS_CACHE}}, $line,
}
filehandledescriptionprevnextTop
sub filehandle {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{FILEHANDLE};
}
get_eofdescriptionprevnextTop
sub get_eof {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{EOF};
}
get_filedescriptionprevnextTop
sub get_file {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{FILE};
}
get_next_record_from_cachedescriptionprevnextTop
sub get_next_record_from_cache {
	my ($self) = @_;
	
	my $line = shift @{$self->{RECORDS_CACHE}};
	if (defined $line) {
		return $self->parse_record_line($line);
	}
	else {
		return undef;
	}
}
get_next_record_from_filedescriptionprevnextTop
sub get_next_record_from_file {
	my ($self) = @_;
	
	while (my $line = $self->filehandle->getline) {
		if ($self->line_looks_like_record($line)) {
			return $self->parse_record_line($line);
		}
		elsif ($self->line_looks_like_header) {
			die "A record was expected but line looks like a header - the header should have been parsed already. $line\n";
		}
	}
	
	$self->set_eof; # When you reach this point the file has finished
	return undef;
}
headerdescriptionprevnextTop
sub header {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{HEADER};
}
increment_records_read_countdescriptionprevnextTop
sub increment_records_read_count {
	my ($self) = @_;
	$self->{RECORDS_READ_COUNT}++;
}
init_headerdescriptionprevnextTop
sub init_header {
	my ($self) = @_;
	$self->{HEADER} = {};
}
init_records_cachedescriptionprevnextTop
sub init_records_cache {
	my ($self) = @_;
	$self->{RECORDS_CACHE} = [];
}
init_records_read_countdescriptionprevnextTop
sub init_records_read_count {
	my ($self) = @_;
	$self->{RECORDS_READ_COUNT} = 0;
}
line_looks_like_commentdescriptionprevnextTop
sub line_looks_like_comment {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	return ($line !~ /^#{2}/) ? 1 : 0;
}
line_looks_like_headerdescriptionprevnextTop
sub line_looks_like_header {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	return ($line =~ /^#{2}/) ? 1 : 0;
}
line_looks_like_recorddescriptionprevnextTop
sub line_looks_like_record {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	return ($line !~ /^#/) ? 1 : 0;
}
line_looks_like_versiondescriptionprevnextTop
sub line_looks_like_version {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	return ($line =~ /^##gff-version/) ? 1 : 0;
}
next_recorddescriptionprevnextTop
sub next_record {
	my ($self) = @_;
	
	my $record;
	if ($self->record_cache_not_empty) {
		$record = $self->get_next_record_from_cache;
	}
	else {
		$record = $self->get_next_record_from_file;
	}
	
	if (defined $record) {
		$self->increment_records_read_count;
	}
	return $record;
}
opendescriptionprevnextTop
sub open {
	my ($self, $filename) = @_;
	
	my $read_mode = ($filename !~ /\.gz$/) ? '<' : '<:gzip';
	$self->{FILEHANDLE} = FileHandle->new($filename, $read_mode) or die "Cannot open file\" $filename\". $!";
}
parse_and_store_generic_header_linedescriptionprevnextTop
sub parse_and_store_generic_header_line {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	
	my ($key,@values) = split(/\s+/,$line);
	$self->header->{$key} = join(' ',@values);
}
parse_and_store_version_linedescriptionprevnextTop
sub parse_and_store_version_line {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	
	my $version = (split(/\s+/,$line))[1];
	$self->header->{VERSION} = $version;
}
parse_header_sectiondescriptionprevnextTop
sub parse_header_section {
	my ($self) = @_;
	
	my $filehandle = $self->filehandle;
	while (my $line = $filehandle->getline) {
		if ($self->line_looks_like_header($line)) {
			$self->recognize_and_store_header_line($line);
		}
		elsif ($self->line_looks_like_record($line)) {
			$self->add_to_records_cache($line); # unfortunatelly the while reads the first line after the header section and in zipped files we cannot go back
			return;
		}
	}
}
parse_record_linedescriptionprevnextTop
sub parse_record_line {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	
	chomp $line;
	$line =~ s/(#.+)$//;
	my $comment_string = $1;
	my ($seqname, $source, $feature, $start, $end, $score, $strand, $frame, $attributes_string) = split(/\t/,$line);
	my @attributes = split(/;\s*/,$attributes_string);
	
	return GenOO::Data::File::GFF::Record->new({
		SEQNAME     => $seqname,
		SOURCE      => $source,
		FEATURE     => $feature,
		START_1     => $start, # 1-based
		STOP_1      => $end, # 1-based
		SCORE       => $score,
		STRAND      => $strand,
		FRAME       => $frame,
		ATTRIBUTES  =>\@ attributes,
		COMMENT     => $comment_string,
	});
}
recognize_and_store_header_linedescriptionprevnextTop
sub recognize_and_store_header_line {
	my ($self, $line) = @_;
	if ($self->line_looks_like_version($line)) {
		$self->parse_and_store_version_line($line);
		
	}
	else {
		$self->parse_and_store_generic_header_line($line);
	}
}
record_cache_is_emptydescriptionprevnextTop
sub record_cache_is_empty {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return ($self->record_cache_size == 0) ? 1 : 0;
}
record_cache_not_emptydescriptionprevnextTop
sub record_cache_not_empty {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return ($self->record_cache_size > 0) ? 1 : 0;
}
record_cache_sizedescriptionprevnextTop
sub record_cache_size {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return scalar @{$self->records_cache};
}
records_cachedescriptionprevnextTop
sub records_cache {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{RECORDS_CACHE};
}
records_read_countdescriptionprevnextTop
sub records_read_count {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->{RECORDS_READ_COUNT};
}
set_eofdescriptionprevnextTop
sub set_eof {
	my ($self) = @_;
	$self->{EOF} = 1;
}
set_filedescriptionprevnextTop
sub set_file {
	my ($self, $value) = @_;
	$self->{FILE} = $value if defined $value;
}
versiondescriptionprevnextTop
sub version {
	my ($self) = @_;
	return $self->header->{VERSION};
}
General documentation
EXAMPLESTop
    # Create object
    my $gff_file = GenOO::Data::File::GFF->new({
          FILE => 't/sample_data/sample.gff.gz'
    });
    
    # Read one record at a time
    my $record = $gff_file->next_record();
